lesson_cases.lesson_topic: Present Simple for routines and habits
lesson_cases.course_materials: Present Simple structure, adverbs of frequency, daily routines vocabulary

objectives: Use Present Simple for habitual actions
Describe daily routines using gaming context

timeline.description: Discuss favorite video games and when students play them
Introduce Present Simple structure and adverbs of frequency
Sentence building with gaming vocabulary and routines
Describe ideal gaming day using Present Simple

reference.theory_content: The Present Simple tense is used for habits, routines, and general truths. Structure: Subject + base verb (add -s for he/she/it). Adverbs of frequency: always, usually, often, sometimes, never come before the main verb.

practice_questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'I usually _____ (play) video games after school.'
Which sentence is correct?
options: He is play football every Saturday

test_questions.question: Which adverbs describe frequency?
test_questions.explanation: Always, often, sometimes are adverbs of frequency

reference.lesson_title: Talking About Past Experiences and Travel
objectives: Use Past Simple for completed actions
reference.theory_content: Past Simple describes completed actions in the past. Regular verbs: add -ed. Irregular verbs: have special forms (go-went, see-saw). Time expressions: yesterday, last week, in 2020, when I was young.

lesson_cases.course_materials: Present Perfect structure, ever/never, for/since, life experiences

objectives: Use Present Perfect for life experiences
reference.theory_content: Present Perfect: have/has + past participle. Used for experiences without specific time, recent actions with present relevance, and actions continuing from past to present. Use 'for' with periods, 'since' with points in time.

practice_questions.question: Which time expression goes with Present Perfect?

test_questions.question: Which sentences are correct?
options: I have lived here for 5 years
She has visited Paris last year
He has never seen this movie
test_questions.explanation: Present Perfect with 'for' and 'never' is correct
